ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5 hours per week
more than 10 hours
5 hours
10 hours
5-8 hours
15 hours per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: 1. Well organized lectures 2. Well organized course website 3. Interesting and useful topics
He provided us a lot of business insights, but the class was disorganized and unsystematic.

I think the course could improve tremendously if it were split into two distinct sections: Accounting then Finance. I feel introducing a midterm test to evaluate accounting, and focusing the final exam largely on finance would make the content more manageable and allow the students to learn more about each topic.
It was very stressful having an exam that was 70% of our grade.
very good, related to real world,
very nice job

I learned a lot throughout this course, but I thought that the homework grades should not be on correctness but on effort. I spent countless hours on the homework problems and only received 2/2.5 sometimes.
good

The class got more interesting in the second half, mostly because everyone got over the bottleneck of the accounting part. When evaluation is added, accounting makes much more sense. I understand the necessity to follow the lecture sequence, and Stanley did excellent job combining those two (excellent!) Perhaps a more balanced workload in accordance with the lecture topic would make this class more interesting.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Stanley Garstka  Stanley is an excellent lecturer. I enjoyed his lectures very much. He always delivers the topics clearly and provides great examples to help us understand the material better. He's also helpful in answering questions.

Instructor: Stanley Garstka  Dr. Gartska is phenomenal. He has an innate ability for teaching and fostering discussion. Even in a topic like accounting, he made it fun and interesting. I learned more from this course than any other. Lectures feel as if you are listening to a story and you want to know the end.
Instructor: Stanley Garstka  Stan was fantastic! Interesting and knowledgable.
Instructor: Stanley Garstka  very good, and responsible
Instructor: Stanley Garstka  a very nice professor
Instructor: Stanley Garstka  good

Instructor: Stanley Garstka  Stan really knows what to teach in an intro-level accounting class, and how to teach those never did accounting before. And looking back, he taught us the very essence of managerial accounting. I am glad I took this class.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to other students. This course is very helpful for students who want to learn fundamental accounting and finance knowledge.
Difficult, but useful introduction to accounting.
very good for the students to establish the basic knowledge for accounting
Very practical, intro level class of accounting and finance
a good course for students who want to gain basic understanding about accounting and little finance
yes
Good course. Learn valuable skills necessary for management in nonprofit or corporate sector
